text: We had the Basel Duck and it was not bad, it was awful.  I complained but the response was it wasn't their fault.  They refused to make any concessions.  We were charged almost $40 and we didn't eat the duck because it sucked.  Be aware.  There people take no responsibility for serving a bad meal  I will never go back to this place.
Wow! This is the best Thai food I've had since Thailand! The atmosphere is delightful, the servers smile and promptly greet you, and the food is absolutely incredible. Try the panang, yum yum.

My new favorite from this place is their Tom Kra Gai soup... The flavors are amazing! It is just SOOOO good and nothing I could ever replicate at home! Place is a tad pricey so I don't eat there as much as I would like to, but I still get take out about once a month and I have never been disappointed!

First Thai place I've been to in Arizona.  The place is decently sized compared to other Thai places I've been to.   Looks like a family owned business with the whole family working together.   Ordered their beef salad, pad thai, and thai fried rice.  Figured if those are decent, then we can try other food here next time.  The beef in the beef salad tasted like beef jerky, but the seasoning was good.  I've never had beef jerky salad before. The pad thai was good, but I've had a lot better elsewhere. The thai fried rice was probably the best thing that we had there.    The service was mediocre.  Another family came in after us and ordered after us, but somehow got all their food before us.

This place was awesome. the service was amazing and the food was fantastic. Highly recommend this. We had bbq chicken, spicey fried rice, won ton soup and spring rolls. My wife, 3 kids and I will be coming back next week.

I have been looking for great Thai food, my daughter brought me here.  The drunken noodles are the best I've had!  The vegetables are fresh and firmly cooked, the noodles are perfectly spiced and not too oily, and the chicken is tender.  I can't wait to try the coconut soup, pineapple fried rice and the spicy green beans....excellent menu!
By far the best Thai I've had in the valley. Sala Thai is a hidden gem. We go often and plan to continue to do so for as long as they are open.
Went here for dinner, ordered Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles and Penang Curry. Worst Pad Thai ever, even the vegetables were raw in the curry. Never again.

I understand the other yelp reviews were based on Westside standards, but lets be honest here: this food is just not good.  I understand that the 623 doesn't have many Thai options, but I would rather drive an extra 15 minutes to an establishment where the food is decent than bear the less than par excuse for Thai food I received here.    Aside from the poor food, the place was dirty.  The menu I received was sticky with food - make the effort to wash down your plastic sheathed menus for sanitation please? With only one other party in the entire place, my food took 25 minutes to come up.  5 people total in an entire restaurant should not have caused such a backup in the kitchen - and I'm used to typical Asian restaurant service.  Don't settle, Westsiders, trust me when I say this place is not legit - once you taste GOOD Thai, you'll know what I'm talking about.

I haven't been to Sala Thai since they added a whole new room of dining, which is saying something! The added seating means there is usually no wait. I'm back to say that I still love it! The basil friend rice wins awards for a reason, people, but the pineapple fried rice is good, too! However, it is very very spicy. Take the 1-5 scale seriously, I air on the wimpy side. My friend had the spicy pumpkin basil, which was pretty good, too. The menu is extensive, and I'm still perusing!  Everything on the menu can be made vegetarian, just request tofu or no meat. I wish they listed this somewhere on the menu instead of shunning you to the tiny vegetarian corner, which doesn't feature anything spectacular. I got the pad thai and found it a little lackluster.   The boba is wonderful, and wonderfully huge. I enjoyed the taro last time!

Disappointed to find out that today, Mother's Day, is their last business day.  My kids enjoyed the orange chicken.  We enjoyed our entire meal and recommend their customer service.  See you somewhere soon Sala Thai!
Extensive menu, good service, wonderful flavors... Great place for Thai food in the West Valley.

Got mine to go, quick service.  Spicy basil fried rice: tasty but it had these star shaped carrots that I could've done without. Got number 3 medium spicy, and it was spicier than I expected but I loved it.  Drunken noodle: also had these random star shaped carrots again. Otherwise it was great. Good portions.  Tip: Make sure they give you utensils and chili sauce if you order to go!
SO GOOD! The pumpkin curry is the bomb. Everything was yummy and so affordable. The portions are great. The atmosphere is quirky but fun. The tank full of fake fish is fun to gaze at.

Are kidding me? TERRIBLE service! I waited for 15 mins. W/O anyone coming to my table! I had to go up and get  my own menu and remind the staff I was waiting. Go to Wild Thaiger or Thai Rama...better food and WAY better service!

They have just expanded the place.  I have eaten here for years through several owners.  The food is fresh and very flavorful.  The people are delightful.  Having spent some time in Thialand, the food is somewhat Americanized.  Service is fine.  Definatly a hole in the wall type of place, with good food, nice people and very casual atmosphere.

Went in on a Sunday afternoon for the first time.  I ordered the Drunken Noodles with chicken, and my friend ordered the Pad Thai. We both enjoyed our dishes. I wasn't crazy about the pad thai but loved the Drunken Noodles and would definitely order again. We both also got the coffee frozen drink. (They offer many different flavored "Mocktails" and it was very good).   The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the service. It was friendly, but I had to ask for things a couple times before I got them. Not a big deal but the reason why I withheld a star. I would recommend the food and will be back.

Had a horrible experience my very first time eating at this restaurant. To start off, we weren't offered drinks the first time the waitress visited us. I noticed there were no condiments at the table such as salt and pepper shakers, and in order to receive them we had to flag down the waitress and actually get out of the booth just to get soy sauce. I admit the food that I ordered (chicken fried rice) was good but after eating it, I found a light hair in my food. It was actually in my mouth and I had to grossly pull it out. None of us at the table had light hair (we all had black hair or dark hair).   I notified the waitress about the hair and and she offered to get me a new plate of the same dish but honestly I was so disgusted that I didn't want the dish. I asked if we could get the dish taken off the bill and at first the waitress said yes, but then the manager came to our table and had the nerve to say that the hair didn't come from their employees, and insinuated that the hair came from us. I told her that I wasn't going to pay for something that had a long hair in the food. She still refused to take the meal off the tab (which by the way was only $9)  and instead offered us a promotional punch card that would've required us to dine in five times before receiving a $20 gift card of some sort. But I had no intention of coming back to dine there and told her that. She then said that there was nothing else she could do, and wouldn't be giving me back the money that I had paid for the plate with the hair in it. She then said that it was the owner who refused to comp the meal. I had asked to speak to him but apparently it was over the phone, and he wasn't actually in the restaurant.   After going back and forth she then unwillingly took 20% off the bill. I was still unsatisfied with this offer but finally decided to take it because I knew it wasn't going to go anywhere and was fed up with arguing over a silly matter that could have been handled very easily. We then asked for the check to be split as we gave them the money and it took over 10 minutes before we even received our money back. And on top of that, I was supposed to receive $11.60 back as my change and instead only got back $10.   I work in the restaurant industry as well as a server, and always try to be a pleasant customer, but I do know that when a customer is upset with something you're supposed to accommodate their needs.  Needless to say I will never come back to this restaurant. Service was horrible and the way they handle situations is very unprofessional.
Good in a pinch, but nothing to write home about. For very good Thai food, check out Thai-Lana on Indian School.
Been coming here for a couple years.  Curry doesn't disappoint.  I like pumpkin, green, and panang.  Yum

Good prices! Really liked the crispy eggrolls. The Pad Thai and the pineapple fried rice were pretty good. The Pad Thai had a bit too much sauce for our taste. The Thai iced tea with boba was also pretty good. Will probably return.

So glad to have found great Thai in my neighborhood.  We thought when we moved away from Tempe that we had lost our access to great ethnic food.  Luckily we found this little gem.  Great ambience, friendly quick service, and fantastic food.  We ordered the green curry chicken and the drunken noodles with vegetables.  Great sized portions for reasonable price.  We got ours on a 3 out of 5 scale of heat and it was perfect for us.  I have a feeling we'll become regulars.

I would not even give them a 1 star, but then I wouldn't be able to write this. We saw the reviews on "Check Please",  and decided to hit it on the way home from my wife's job. Having a total of 75 years experience between the two of us in the restaurant and hospitality business, we were very disappointed. We contemplated leaving but decided to stay.Arrived Saturday at 6 pm. We checked in for a table, there were 4 open inside. Only waited a couple minutes because they had dirty plates and had to wipe and clean. The hostess brought us to the table and then left. We sat waiting for a server for 18 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. We put a order in for 2 sodas. We didn't receive any beverages that we ordered, including water from the time we satdown, was 38 minutes. When the server did bring soda, she only brought one. Huh? Other diners next to us were seated and brought water for each person. After we finally caught a server, I asked about my soda and she replied that they ranout of clean glasses. Kinda strange because considering the soda and water were the same glasses. When the server finally came to our table, after my my wife went up to tell someone we were ready to order, which was 53 minutes since we were seated, she didn't even mention any of the specials. We decided to order appetizer, food and desert all at once so we could get our food. Watching the front door get filled with a line of people, we noticed a large amount was to go food. The number of To Go Orders had to have come after we were seated. It seemed like the To Go Orders were more important then the customers seated inside. More food To Go was going out then inside. When the server brought food, she only brought chicken skewers. At least we had something. When we tried it, it was cold. Hey we are really trying here. Our food finally arrived. Mine first, then my wife's 5 minutes later. She ordered curry and never received the rice to go along with it. We flagged down a server and she brought the rice. So much confusion. I had the Pahd Thai shrimp with extra shrimp. When meal came, I ate the shrimp, and counted each shell on a plate totally 9 pieces total. Being a big guy and a big eater, if I buy it I will eat it.  I couldn't even eat half of my meal. Something was not right. I had my wife try my dish and she said it was off too, so it wasn't just my taste buds. Not seeing a server in a long time, my wife decided to go up and try and get a soda refill. She did say the owner was nice. We we were finished with meal and waited for our sticky rice which never came so my wife went to check on it. They said 10 minutes which turned into 20 minutes. So sad. The diners next to us who came in 35 minutes after us got check and were out before us. Since server didn't check on us, I asked her for the check. It came 15 minutes later. By the way , my meal was $10 and the 4 pieces of extra shrimp were $9. I should've bought another entree because I would've got noodles too for a $1 more. C'mon, really? All said and done, it was a total of 1 hour and 28 minutes of HELL. 2 Thumbs down. I have never been so disappointed in restaurant ever. And I go out alot. I do Consulting for restaurants for those who ask for help. My advice from sitting 2 tables from restrooms in back is; You need a designated busser. You need food runners. You need a hostess, not a server seating customers. You need a designated Phone / To Go person, not a server who should be taking care of Guest and their food. Your place should have 1 server on one side and one server on other and one for outside. You need to have Cooks make food in order it comes in, not To Go food first. Your Big Impression is for the Guests inside. First timers like Me. Then I will order food To Go next time. For being the size you are, there is to much Chaos. Time Management Problem.

Been here 5 times now and the food has been delicious every time. Some items can be spicy but it's worth the sweat storm.  Love the ribs! Prices are super reasonable. Fish talk needs a bit of cleaning though.

We had takeout tonight.   . My wife had the Pad Thai, and it was tasteless.  I had a cashew with shrimp dish with 6 hotness but it wasn't very hot at all(They have a hotness scale of 1-5, so they should have known I was looking for something very spicy.)  Krua Thai Cuisine restaurant is better.

I decided to try this place after reading the reviews on yelp. I had the beef with brocolli with steamed rice and the beef satay. Their food was delicious and it's probably one of the best that I have had in awhile. I'm very glad that I tried this place out and I will definitely be returning :).
Good thai food. Once of the better within the area. The thai tea is extremely over sweetened though and I always water it down in half. Everything so far has been good.

Sala Thai is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Highly recommended. It's a small neighborhood establishment that makes some of the best pumpkin curry around. I also appreciate their 1-5 heat scale. Let me warn you, however, never go above a "three" unless you like your Thai food really hot.   In addition to traditional Thai offerings, the menu also contains a few Chinese dishes in case your party is not 100% onboard with Thai. Yes, it's a small restaurant with occasional small restaurant issues, but the presentation of the food is often consistent with a much more expensive destination. And the décor! It's hard to describe. Let's just say it's fun.

So far, my favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix.  I faced a lot of disappointments and mediocrity before I found Thai Lahna and crowned it my valley favorite, but while I have enjoyed consistently good Thai at Thai Lahna, I have never gotten that glorious rush from eating their food.  The first time I tried anything from Sala Thai, my girlfriend ordered me Green Curry to go after dining there with her mother.  When she requested it Thai Hot, the server politely giggled behind her hand.  That curry was the single spiciest thing I have ever eaten.  I am accustomed to spice, but the girl took one bite and promptly ate two slices of bread to cool her esophagus.  I don't know if the spice dispenser malfunctioned, or they felt like messing with us or what, but it was basically a little cardboard trapezoid of napalm.  Even then, the delicate, sweet, earthy, volcanic flavors of their green curry came through.  A week or so later I found an excuse to try a visit to Sala in person.  I am often crippled by extensive menus, I find myself agonizing over the whole concept of "But what if one of my all-time favorite dishes is on this menu, but I choose the wrong thing and never come back, and my life is .003% less satisfying...", and the Sala Thai menu features pictures that make everything look delicious.  Ultimately I chose to go with Spicy Eggplant, which is out of character for me, because in trying any new Thai restaurant, my two defaults to establish a barometer are Green Curry and Pad Thai.  If you get those right, I trust you to do everything else.  So my Spicy Eggplant hits the table...you know those moments when food looks so spectacular that you're almost embarassed to defile it by eating it?  That was the case here, and not because it used fancy technique or elaborate chef-driven painting with sauces, but because the produce was so fresh, and the balance of colors so gorgeous, it essentially became some sort of accidental, outsider pop art.   Or something.  The important part is that it was exquisitely delicious.  The eggplant's texture was silky as it should be, the balance of sweet, savory, earthy and spicy was perfect, the rice was the proper consistency..it was what I want Thai food to be.  I have not been to Thailand, I have no close friends or relatives of Thai descent, I haven't read an encyclopedia of Thai cooking.  I only know that my mouth and belly left pleased as they have been by no other Thai place in town, and that is good enough for me.

Absolutely the worst service ever. My food came out a full half hour before the other three folks at the table. so my meal was room temperature by the time my wife got hers. The other two meals crawled out an age later. So stupid! Tasted pleasant but so what!!!??? If I want to eat alone or in front of everyone I will stay home. Yack!

I've lived in the neighborhood for 11 years and I love Thai food. However, I was reminded why I've stayed away from here for the past three years. I ordered the special today; lettuce wraps with chicken. The lettuce was the best part. The chicken had good flavor, too. But there was barely a quarter cup of it. This dish was mostly comprised of noodles!, large chunks of onion and white button mushroom, and bland tofu. It had a side of three sauces, all loaded with sugar. For a much better Thai lettuce wrap, I highly recommend Pei Wei, believe it or not!

This place is priceless,.a big rip! I ordered the thai bbq ribs, well,its a cheap steak thrown on a grill wity thai sauce to dip it, i really need a steak knife to cut this steak,all i had ws a butter knife .wht i really needed was a buzz saw,.i would not give this to my dog!!

We went to Sala Thai for my sisters birthday since she is a big fan of Thai food.  As for myself, i could do without curry, but will try not to let that influence my review.    When we got there, there seemed to be plenty of seating and the waitress seemed quite accommodating.  We ordered a ton of food including Tom Yum soup,pad Thai, pad Sui,  curry chicken, BBQ beef, and pineapple fried rice.  Like I said earlier, I'm not a huge fan of curry but i did try some and I liked it more than I normally do.  I did not however try the Tom Yum soup just because I don't like it in general.  The pad Thai and pad Sui (spelling?) was OK,  but I feel like I've had better.  What I did love however was the pineapple fried rice and BBQ beef.  I could not get enough of it!  I almost finished the entire serving of fried rice by itself.    So to sum up my review, if you are a fan of Thai food, I think you will enjoy it a lot (my sister swears by it and spent a year in Thailand). However,  I'm just not a huge fan of Thai food, and although they do offer a lot of neutral plates (BBQ plates come to mind), their specialty items I find are lacking.

How do you judge a Thai restaurant? You judge them on the simplest dish, i.e. pad Thai! This place could not even get their pad Thai right, as it more like some chewy noodles that were insipid. I don't understand why and how people can rate this place so highly, and all I can say is that I feel sorry for people who have yet to experience good Thai food. I will avoid this place on my trips to Phoenix.

This particular restaurant has changed ownership a few times in the past year (2014) and with each change, there's been quite a significant swing in ambiance, authenticity and food quality.   Honestly, the new owners would have been well served to change the name to avoid confusion.  Anyway, the GOOD news is that new ownership (as of late 2014) has really raised Sala Thai back again to a much better than average Thai-food standard.   The silly idea of strictly Vegan Thai is, thankfully, long gone.    Sala Thai has some great lunch specials.   Good quantity, variety and a great price.   If you really want hot/authentic, tell the server.  Every time I've done so, they've relayed my request back to the kitchen where the Thai cooks went 'native' for me.   Yum.  Finally, I should mention that Sala Thai recently started having a live Thai band on Saturday nights.   I was shocked to see this on my last visit and I can't think of a restaurant outside of Los Angeles that offers it.    I really hope Sala Thai just keeps getting better and better.    Sala Thai is definitely worth checking out.

I have driven by this unassuming place many times and always wondered how the food was. My daughter and I had lunch here today and shared an order of crab wontons, cashew chicken, beef ribs and beef with yellow curry.  Everything was really good and there was plenty left over to take home.  We got the spiciest option for the curry and it was delicious.  We will definitely go back and try some other things next time.  The noodle dishes looked very good.

Excellent spicy basil fried rice! I've gotten it twice with extra hot spiciness and it's been awesome! I also tried the chicken dumplings and they were really good. If you ask for some spicy paste they'll bring you 4 different types FOUR! awesome variety. I would recommend it for most people!

New chef. New fantastic!  Fried rice is amazing, but so was everything else. Must try the peanut sauce which is made fresh from scratch everyday.  The new chef cooks authentic Thai, so be careful of the heat levels.  I normally get 5 hot because I like it spicy,  but because of the new chef I went 4 and glad I did. It was spicy hot and delicious.   My daughter and son in law joined us from Scottsdale and they have a favorite Thai restaurant there, but this was the best they ever had. The decor needs updating,  but the staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.
I've only ordered takeout so far, but I love the interior of the place, the food is good and the people there are very friendly!

This is the first time trying this place and I have to say.... Great food!  This definitely a due over for the family. The Pad Thai has great flavor I would recommended this dish to everyone. Let me start out by saying Thai places are not created equally. This has set the bar to a whole new level. I am giving it 4 stars. The only reason for that is because I just had wished that the waiter would come check on us a little more often to see if we needed water or what not.

I love Sala Thai; the food is really great.  My only problem; the prices went way up and the size of the servings got much smaller!  We've all been in a pinch this year; your food is great but don't run customers off by under-serving.  Thanks!

Tasty pumpkin shrimp curry, but I didn't like their pad thai that much.  Big fan of everything they fry, and I'm not usually so much for fried food. Their wontons and fried banana dessert with coconut ice cream were crunchy and perfectly formed. Drinks were also great. Prompt service and good prices.
Food was excellent.  Hot and sour soup was amazing.  Waitress was new so need to cut her a break.  Service is normally really good.

Okay, so I've sort of found a Thai restaurant that I like now.  I LOVE Thai food, and have had some great Thai food prior to moving to AZ.  This place has one of the only curries that I have liked here.  The place was a bit funky, totally empty on a Sunday night, and in the usual dead strip mall, but the food was good.  Here is the reason for the missing star,  They didn't have Pra Ram (you know the chicken with spinach and peanut sauce?)  Well, I really like that dish, and can't frequent a place that doesn't serve it.  So when I am craving curry, this is the place I'll go.  When I want some good Pra Ram, it's back to San Francisco.....

Green curry dish was very good, although consistency of the soup was too thin, but maybe is because we order the level 1 of spicy; also ordered fish cakes with sweet Thai sauce with peanuts but I was expecting to enjoy some shrimp cakes, unfortunately they do not carry in their menu.

Yummy!! I highly recommend the curries! Red, yellow, green, we had all 3 today (take-out, ate at home with unexpected dinner guests) and will definitely eat here as regulars. The portions are big enough to share, or not! The ingredients are fresh. The staff is very nice, over the phone and in person. The place is clean and low key, dress up or down, just go there!

Amazing! So my boyfriend and I found this gem one Sunday afternoon and always crave the food all the time ever sense. We don't get to come often, seeing as though we live far, but it's worth the drive!   The beef salad is to die for, so flavorful! And I love their sticky rice which is sometimes hard to find when going to try a Thai place. Boba isn't Thai, but their variety of boba choices are endless and so yummy. The servers are very friendly and attentive. I have yet to try dessert but I will next time for sure!   Go try Sala for authentic Thai. You can trust me, because I work at a Thai restaurant myself and still go here to eat!

My favorite Thai restaurant ever! I usually get take-out from here, but have eaten here more than plenty of times! Everyone is always so nice, and the food is always hot and ready in a few minutes. They have never messed up on my order, and everyone is always really sweet when we go eat there, or when I get take out. The food is very authentic, priced very reasonable, and the menu has a HUGE selection of all sorts of Thai food. I love it here!

Google noted their Saturday and Sunday hours are 11:30 AM, nope they open at 12:00. The day I went (Saturday) they opened at 12:30, over 10 cars in parking lot, people peering in a restaurant with no lights on, funny! Half of them left thinking they shut down. I also left and returned 15 minutes later, staff said they had a rough night of drinking the night before, I understood !  I had the Drunken noodles, Red curry duck, Pork Satay, Pad Thai with Shrimp. Drunken noodles and Red Curry Duck (Awesome) Pad Thai, weird taste, brown sauce just had a strange taste. Visiting Thailand over 25 times, I know my pad thai but this wasn't good. Pork satay had a great taste and nice char but very tough meat.  I feel the prices are high for what you get and it would also be nice to enjoy the meal with a glass of wine or a cold Singha.  I will try this place again.
Strange service, but the red curry is to die for!

We had a wonderful meal here! We started with two fruit mocktails - pineapple and watermelon.  They were very refreshing, and at $3 apiece, well worth the price to cool some of the spiciness of the food (which was tolerable at a 3).  We had the crab wontons, tom yum, basil duck (which was the special) and spicy basil fried rice with beef. Everything was really great, and priced very moderately. The waiter checked on us consistently and everything about our experience was perfect. From the moment we sat down to the payment of our $45 bill - which is not bad considering how much we ate! GO. You won't be disappointed.

Just had dinner overall ok place solid 3 stars, flavored are not very sophisticated, just moved to the area and decided to try the place. Service was prompt and people were nice. I hope I am not too hard on them but I have had Thai @ other places, with more richer flavors. I may give it another chance and try other dishes. Btw prices are very reasonable.
The beef salad was authentic and delicious. Everything I order at this place is amazing. Don't be fooled by the fish curtains this place is the real deal.
Love this place!! Freshest spring rolls ever!! Very authentic dishes & flavor, not for those who did not grow up O.J. fresh Thai!
Some of the best Tom yum soup I've ever had! Sala Thai catfish is incredible! Got my Thai fix tonight! Plastic fish are fun but I don't know what they feed them....

I have always gotten very fresh, flavorful food from Sala Thai. I love their green curry, tofu dishes, and various beef dishes. They have actual Thai Spring rolls which are so healthy for people and so cool and refreshing in the summer. Better than greasy fried sticks! The sauce for the rolls is also very nice with a good peanut base. The soups are very good too and while a bit expensive, they are enough for two people, even three.  I've always gotten take out and the people have always been very friendly and sweet. I enjoy fresh vegetables and the freshness of the ingredients. It's a place I will continue to frequent.
Tom Kra Gai = great.  Plus, the fake fish in the fish tank provide never-ending entertainment.

This place was horrible.  Check the food administration website for health code violations before you go.  I thought I should have made a 360 right out of there when I saw the plastic floating fish.  Disgusting food and poor excuse for Thai food.

Got a $60 to go order for the fam. Asked for lowest level of spicy ("1") so we could add heat individually at home if we wanted to. The food was fire! Like a 4. Not cool. (Literally). Food wasn't that great either, better Thai places around. Obviously won't be going back.

Tom Kha soup is the star here. A small (half) order is more than enough for a meal; you have to ask for half order, it's not on the menu. Super flavors. Not knowing the portion size, I ordered the green curry chicken, too. I love spicy, and ordered it the hottest they offered. I was disappointed that it was still fairly mild for five chili pepper rating. It's worth the trip - authentic place.

Our upper office meeting was held at Sala Thai yesterday.  Most of us eat out a lot because we are mobile and are meeting clients. So we are a particular bunch. This place is owned and run by an actual Thai family who visit Thailand and their family there.  The help are Thai and the food is authentic although as all foodies understand  versions of dishes vary by regions and by the chef/cook crafting each dish.   If every chefs/restaurants dish tasted the same life would be boring!!       The Curry is exceptional no matter what type, the usual dishes we enjoy are always freshly cooked.    The owners will not serve my favorite Mango with Sticky rice (heaven) unless just the right mangos are available.I also get carry out from here several times a month and am always pleased.   Their lemon chicken soup drives away my colds.   The ice cream they make fresh with coconut milk is wonderful.  This is usually a peaceful, low noise get away with a large clientele.  As for those that want alcohol , most of us go to have amazing food---- several bars are close if you need alcohol.

So I was born in Bangkok and lived there till I was seven, I may have forgotten my Thai language, but the flavors and foods are seared into me forever.  There is something that most Americans don't really understand about Thai food.  Everyone has their own take on recipes.  American food was like that at one point as well... thank goodness we still have our differences in BBQ styles...  anyway the point is what makes one Thai restaurant better than another is mostly preference, not authenticity.  That being said, Sala Thai's cuisine is the closest thing I have found to the delightful flavors of my youth.  There flavor's are all spot on and exactly the way they should be.  There ingredients are great quality (Where do they find kale that sweet!?!?) and make the food that much better.  There Prices are ridiculously low!  What is not to like about this place?  What you will get if you dine here; Friendly service (they are Thai, I don't think they know how to not be friendly), Excellent food (flavor and quality), at the best prices!  What you wont get; Anything Fancy, and you shouldn't Thai food is enough in and of itself!  Anyways check it out you wont be disappointed.  If it is to far West for you can check out Swaddee, though it is more expensive..   *edit*  The food is still great but the prices have gone up to the point where it isn't the same killer value it once was... still, great Thai food.
This was so great and local! The food was creative and fantastic and very authentic and the prices very very reasonable. I will be back!
Excellent!!! Yellow chicken curry and drunken noodles are amazing!!

Wow, SO yummy!!  I'm here for lunch and eating the pumpkin curry with chicken at a level 4 spicy. I can taste so many lovely flavors and out has great spice too!!    My friend is having the phad see we, and he's been to Thailand many times, he's loving it too!  He thinks it's one of the best he's had anywhere!  I will be back!

Consistently good although sometimes a little slow when they are busy on Friday and Saturday nights. Weeknights and lunch are better. We like the yellow curry, chicken satay and Thai Iced Tea. The noodle dishes are good too. When we go out for Thai, we prefer Sala Thai over any other Thai food we've tried in Phoenix.

Our go-to Thai restaurant. Love the food and the staff is always friendly. We usually get one of their curries (all are delicious) and the pineapple fried rice. The vegetable rolls are also delicious. Glad to have this place around the corner!
Good food like the chicken chow mein. Go for more spicy than you are use to. Com paired to others there spicy is a little milder.

The 2 of us went to Sala Thai last night and expected so much better based on these reviews on yelp. We looked at the menu on line and knew the prices were high and thought they must be good at those prices.   Ok the Thai Tea will get a high rating for sure.  The place was busy. The booth seating was comfortable and the fish tank with the plastic fish was interesting. The hangings on the walls were pretty.  But the reason we were here was to try a different Thai Restaurant. Once we ordered our food it came out too fast. It must have already been cooked. The Beef Panang had no flavor and the sauce was too thin.  The beef in it was tough and had stringy bits as well. The toughness made me think microwave. But I have no fact about that. The broccoli floating in the Panang sauce tasted good. The Pad Thai seemed to be a glued tangled mess of various size noodles. It was loaded with fried egg. No flavor.  The Stuffed angel wings were huge and not sure what the stuffing was as we couldn't identify it.  A bit of a freezer taste. Hot on outside but not warm in the middle. The cover up flavor came from the sweet chili sauce we poured over it. We had to ask for more sauce.  No one ever came to see how our food was until the end when they brought the check. Yet we were still eating or trying to when they brought the check.  We left so much food on our plates and paid $37.00 and left. We have been eating Thai Food for over 25 years in the Valley and do have our favorite places. However , living  North of the main city, there are not a lot of Thai Restaurants to choose from. We have to make a 35 minute drive to get to one. We will not return to Sala.  We will not go back there.
We are regular visitor to sala Thai..excellent food and service...Red curry is best here....

I gave this place a couple of chances, because the Chinese restaurant which used to be in this location was quite good and I felt some nostalgia in coming here  (I know:  makes no sense; but then again, I rarely do).  This is a SAD excuse for a Thai restaurant.  Here are some of my "issues":  1.  Dry chicken and pork dishes;  2.  Inattentive or incorrect service from both the "family" staff and part-time students, who come and go about as often as you change your underwear (I hope);  3. Staff spends more time taking phone-in orders and dealing with walk-in take out orders than they do with customers eating here.  Though they DO take the time out to sing old, unliked songs from the 70s and 80s up on their karaoke stage with the volume turned up extra high to distract you from the crappy food;  4.  Cleanliness at the tables is subpar;  5.  More than once, the bill has been "inadvertently" miscalculated (and one time, had things on it they never brought to the table).  It doesn't help to complain as management makes clear in half-hearted apologies and mumbling, that it's your fault, white Devil, for not appreciating Asian culture and unreasonably expecting good service.  Spare your taste buds, your wallet and your ears (especially) and go to the other good Thai places in the West Valley.  Buddha will thank you for it
Very good food. very authentic. one of the best Thai food I've ever had.  Must try this place
Drunken Noodle with Beef, 5 hot!!!!! Pad Thai at a 4 woo Hoo!!! This is the best Thai food I have found in PHX, thank you!!

SALA THAI....I just moved here from L.A. where there are dozens of Thai restaurants competing for cheapest lunch and best tasting Thai food. First time I came here the food was pretty greasy. 2nd time the service was  indifferent and snooty. 3rd time was the last time....terrible greasy garlic chicken. People that come here are white people that don't have any concept of the differences in races or nationalities or the kinds of food that makes ethnic food what it is or how it is supposed to taste People that come here are not worldly or not well travelled. Too bad....you've lost a customer. The food is overpriced for what you get.

Sadly, I'll probably never eat here again. My wife and I used to order curry dishes from here regularly, but hadn't for a while because it was never consistent. Half the time it was great, but the rest of the time it was watered down. After deciding to give them one more chance tonight, I was grossly disappointed. My panang curry was so bland that it literally tasted like chicken in nothing but water with cayenne flakes.

Having dinner here with my kids this time was still a treat. The portions are a little small for the price. But every dish has been great. Tom Yum is a must. The Basil Fried Rice is then other must have when we come. The only thing keeping my 5th star is the portion size. Not the typical family size dish for sharing.   Highly recommended Thai in PHX!
Great family run independent business. The food is expertly prepared and properly seasoned per your request. Delicious and served with pride. The only negative is that they don't serve beer.

Was very disappointed with the quality of food. It seems they changed owners or cook,  I use to come here before and the food was good, I brought people and the food was very poor. I ordered Tom Yum soup,  very little, but I mean very little shrimp,  and the flavor was not that good. I also ordered Pad Thai, noodles where very over cooked, and the servings where smaller. Need better presentation on both dishes,  the restaurant was empty,  booths where not that comfortable,  and needed more lighting. Hope this restaurant improves.

I have ordered take out from this place many, many (hungover) times. Never disappoints me!! I always order pad thai and they cook everything perfectly and with the right amount of specified spicy (3 on a scale of 5.)  I have recommended this place to my brother who has also tried it out and liked it, as well as other family members. Food is always ready for picking up according to the time they tell me on the phone- nothing but great things to say!!
Amazing food, the staff was sweet. I wish I lived closer. I loved the soup and the pad Thai, and so did my wife!

My wife and I love this place.  Thankfully we live only a few blocks away. We order out  once a week, yum. It does get busy, so I try to time my order before 6pm. I like the fact that they are so calm, even when they are super busy.

First time going to Sala Thai. Worst experience and will not return. I've been to a lot of Thai restaurants and so figured I'd give this one a try. Definitely will not go back. We were one table of 6 with 2 other tables in the restaurant. The service was very poor. Took 30 minutes to get our drink & food order in, another 50 minutes to get our food. Boyfriend's fried fish plate, once he bit into it, had completely raw fish inside. He asked for a new dish. 20 minutes later they still had not informed us about the whereabouts of his dish. Was his birthday meal and since everyone was about done we asked where his dish was and the server told us "Oh, they are just about to make it". We then decided to cancel dish since the meal experience was over. They did not take the dish off of the final check and we had to ask them to remove it bc he didn't get to eat his meal at all nor would it have been with the rest of the family by the time it would have been brought out. Needless to say that the hassle that came along with the meal could have been avoided. Would not recommend if you have a table of 4 or more.

This place is sooooo yummy! They have an excellent menu choice with almost every Thai dish you can think of! My favorites include their Pad Thai, Fish Cakes, Shrimp Rolls, Seafood Soup and Fried Bananas with homemade Coconut Ice Cream!! Did I mention they also have BOBA?!

I've been coming here for years but won't be any more after a bad pickup experience. I ordered #4  spicy (1-5 scale) red curry and pineapple fried rice. The curry tasted very bland, like key ingredients were missing and was not spicy at all. The fried rice was also off and was not good. I called them to let them know and they just said they don't fix orders unless items are mixed up. Customer service is definitely lacking, I won't be giving them another shot after this. Very disappointing.

This place is pretty solid.  The prices are reasonable and the food is really good.  Warning, they give you a spice level of 1 to 5.  I like it spicy so i chose a 4.  It was extremely spicy.  Next time I will probably scale down to a 2.  I had the veggie egg rolls and drunken noodles.  They were really good.  I ordered some Thai Ice tea to wash down the food, cause it was spicy.  Overall solid experience, the spiciness was my fault for ordering it that hot, but the taste of the food was solid.  I would recommend this place.
The food was excellent.  Each entrée had its own unique flavor.  Recommend the Basil Thai and the coconut pineapple ice cream was amazing!

I love the food, but the service is been terrible lately especially carry out. I called in an order they said 15-20 minutes. We showed up at 30 minutes and they said ten more minutes. I sat and waited as they were really busy. Almost 30 more minutes and asking multiple times the order was ready. They didn't really seem apologetic. Not sure what is going on, but makes me think twice about coming back.

Ordered vegetarian pad thai to go. Serving size is good. Lots of vegetables, which I love, and you dont always find at other places. But the sauce is terrible. It's not traditional pad thai like I get pretty much everywhere else. I eat a lot of asian food, and lately, a lot of thai. Been to about 5 different places in the past week alone, and this pad thai dish was absolutely the worst. Maybe their other food is better, but steer clear of the vegetarian pad thai.

The food is very good.  However, both their portion sizes and their customer service sucks.  Two times our to go order is wrong.  Either my vegetarian husband gets meat in his meal or I get tofu in mine and I wanted chicken.  Sick of constantly having it wrong - or having one dish get cold while we make a second trip to get the other corrected. Also,  noodle dishes don't even full half the box.   Staff is rude...won't do anything for the mistake.  If you order,  be sure to check everything before you leave!!

Ordered red curry with pork and shrimp. Ingredients were fresh and tasty, but portion was somewhat skimpy for the price and the dish itself was uninspired (only a couple slices of bell pepper accompanied the meat). Both problems could be solved by adding some Asian vegetables to the mix at negligible cost. What really disappointed was the rice. It stuck together so badly, they could have sweetened it and called it a "Sticky Rice" dessert! Seriously, it was like the example of bad rice that sticks together on the Minute Rice TV commercial. Also, someone should tell them using plastic fish in an aquarium is tastelessly tacky. Either get real fish or get rid of the tank.

I came with a group of five including 5 year old twins  We ordered a variety of things including egg rolls, spring rolls, vegetable pad thai, masala curry, pumpkin curry, and chow mein.  The pad thai was the worst I have ever had.  It was mushy and had a weird tomato base flavor.  How do you mess up pad thai?! I actually sent it back to order the chow mein to keep things simple. The waitresses on staff that evening seemed inexperienced.  I really did not like the food. The best thing we had was the masala curry.  Oh the kids loved the mocktails!  My cousins frequent this establishment often and they were also disappointed with the service. Maybe it was an "off" day, but I will not be back

They just came out with a new vegan menu along with the regular menu and it was amazing! We tried the spicy noodles and the jungle noodles and they were both perfect! I've always loved going to this place, and with the new vegan menu and so many options, I'm excited to come back and try everything!

The best THAI food in Phoenix! Price a bit on the high side  though considering this is just a small eatery. Their menu is both expansive and expensive.  Anyways, the good news is their food is GOOD! i am speechless.......nothing at all to say cuz my stomach is still FULL! kudos to their chef!
Had pad ti with beef #4 spicy . Nice heat. Normal crap puffs. Very filling. Also ordered drunken chicken heat 3 .
I'm not gonna claim to be the professional on thai food but this place was delicious! The price was right, the room nice, and employees friendly.

Curried tofu can cure any ailment. This also includes hangovers, a touch of the flu, and broken hearts.   With that said, I liked this  little place. I was in town for an event, and craved food not found in a drive-thru or the company of chains. I was not disappointed by Sala.  Generous portions, pleasant ambiance, and the food was wonderfully spiced. I'd definitely eat here again.

On my quest to find acceptable ethnic dishes in my new neighborhood , I came across this restaurant while searching yelp for a decent Thai place. (Please keep in mind, I'm a bit of a Thai food addict, being from NYC and all).  We ordered an assortment of dishes for takeout one night (Pad Thai, Spring Rolls, Wings, and Ginger Beef), all of which was tasty and hot.  Would definitely come back and eat in, or order take out from again.

Not the best Thai food I've had ( the best Thai food I've ever had was in Maui, and it was being cooked out of someone's back yard and sold on the side of the street) but it's pretty good.    I've had their coconut milk soup, pad thai, pad see ew, basil fried rice, green papaya salad, green curry, panang curry and garlic chicken.  All of these are good, although the basil fried rice is a bit too moist and garlic chicken a bit salty for my taste.  Like most other Thai places, the spice level is 1 thru 5 stars.   If you like a good kick, I would say go with 4 stars.  If you like super spicy, skip 5 stars and ask for "thai hot."  I'm a very observant person and to be honest, the many times I've eaten here, I noticed the crowd and they're the type to care about "ambiance" and service rather than the actual food.  For me, it's about how good the food is, then I factor in the service and all that stuff.    The service here isn't exactly top notch.  If you're one of those who care about being asked about how you're doing every 10 minutes, then don't come here.    Overall, for the prices and location and quality of food, this place is really good.  I haven't had a dish where I was like, ew!

Food here was good, but I prefer to have a little more sauce/oil with my noodles.  The flavors were good, but there was so little sauce in our pad se ew, that it was almost dry.  The Pad Ka (coconut lemon grass soup) was tasty, but there was no option to have a small bowl of soup, just a huge $10 serving.  It was a little thin though, not sure if that's cost cutting watering it down, or just they way they make their soup.  Service was fast though and restaurant was clean.

Pad Thai! Been going here for years, although not often enough in the past 5 years since we moved up north around Desert Ridge.   I will warn you, the service and food delivery is SLOW. So, don't come here if you are in a hurry.

I've been here a few times and usually it's much better...in fact, I rave about their veggie Pad Thai and coconut soup.  But I went last night and my order wasn't what I was used to.  My Pad Thai was lacking much flavor, strangely sweet, and it didn't come w the peanuts or lemon (they usually serve w lemon).  It definitely needed the missing crunch and acidity!!  The coconut soup was as good as ever!  We also order orange chicken, but were served orange shrimp...not bad, just not what we were expecting.    Overall, I will definitely go back but a little disappointed w last night's showing

I have been to Sala Thai many many times. They have always provided wonderful service with exceptional food. Keep in mind, this restaurant is a family owned business; therefore, it has the charm and friendliness of that familial feel. I love the personalities of the staff  and the décor of this restaurant. The staff here are very considerate and pays close attention to your needs as a customer.    Remember they know how Thai food is done. This isn't some corporate chain business or formulated menu that they factory out; the food here tastes AUTHENTIC. Each dish is uniquely created with the appropriate flair of the Thai culture.   I have never had issues communicating or expressing what I want or would like with the staff.   I ordered the tom yum, green curry, fried catfish, phad thai, drunken noodles and even a few of their desserts before. These dishes are all magical.  The tom yum was just the right sour flavor and the herbs really bring out the aroma of this dish. I highly suggest starting off with this savory soup.  Drunken noodles has to be one of my favorites at this restaurant. You can never go wrong with this choice as it brings a variant burst of aromatic flavors. If I order really high level spicy food, I always order a thai tea to go with it. Fun Fact: The milky flavors of this sweet and refreshing beverage actually conteracts the spice flavors. Another great way to enjoy this cuisine; why not blend the flavors?  I can honestly say I will continue to come back again and again; I will even bring friends as I have in the past. Sala Thai has won me over with their delicious authentic dishes, friendly staff and charming atmosphere.   OH and they do take out too!

Sala Thai has a really good lunch menu for $8.99 which comes with your entree, salad, egg roll and tom yum soup! They have a variety of options to choose from the entree list which ranges from different noodle dishes to fried rice or even curry. The salad (very small portion) comes with a peanut sauce which is ok. If you have never had it before it has a sweet peanut taste.   For entrees my family ordered: pad thai, pad sai ew, yellow curry and panang curry. Overall we were all satisfied with our orders. The pad saw ew (thick noodles) were my favorite.The pad thai was good too and it has a strong peanut flavoring! The 2 curries were really good and they both have a strong coconut taste to it! If you like coconut flavor then I would recommend you to order the panang curry because the taste was stronger! We ordered all the dishes on a level 3 spicy which was just right for us!  The reason why I am only giving it 4 stars out of 5 is because their thai tea was not up to par. I felt that they did not have enough of the tea flavor in it! However the food was excellent! So if you guys are ever in the area, I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Seriously good curry. Serious. I'm not joking. I'm serious, the curry is very good. Usually when a restaurant has pictures of the food on the menu I become suspicious (think of Denny's and Village Inn), but here the photographs are not indicative of anything bad. In fact, the food looks good. Did I mention the curry is really good.

After having take out from Sala Thai a few times, I can say that the quality of food is hit and miss. Staples such as egg rolls and pad thai are just simply disappointing. The eggs rolls are bland and their pad thai lacks the rich flavor that other thai restaurants serve. On the other hand, their curry and fried rice were quite good. Their take out service seems quite popular and as an apparent consequence, take out orders take longer compared to other restaurants. On the plus side, their prices are quite reasonable.

Not so good. They''ve expanded their dining area but the food is still mediocre at best for Thai food.  But then I'm spoiled I lived in Thailand for 8 months. Ok I ve been back and the food was tremendous I not sure maybe I had an off night last time. Awesome flavors, authentic spices. I highly recommend Sala Thai.
I really like the decor, the food is excellent, friendly staff, prices about $1 more then most places but worth it! One of the best Thai food restaurants in the west valley!

They did have the best Chicken Fried Rice ever eaten, but now everytime I go back, its made differently.  Not as pleased as once before.  I wish they would just keep the old recipe.  I have never had Fried Rice with cooked tomatoes in it either...that was a first...

This place is definitely quite a ways outside downtown Phoenix.  The place is pretty small and does not accommodate large parties, but they adjusted the seating for us.  Some of the dishes we ordered were the beef larb, tom yum seafood soup, curry shrimp, curry chicken, a chicken noodle dish and another seafood dish.  All were pretty average and nothing to rave about.  They did have quite a variety of blended drinks and the coconut banana was pretty good.  The banana flavor was strong taking away from the coconut.
The best Thai food I've had here so far!!  I tried the Pa-nang curry which was amazing!

his is probably the worst dining experience I have had in years. Friend wanted to try this restraunt as was close.  Their version of Thai  food is at best described as horrible... I guess they call it modern Thai. I'd rather eat at McDonald's. &   service was nonexistent, we arrived at t:15 & finally got done at 7. Good luck on refills on your drinks.  If the want bad good & lousy service this is the restraunt for you

The only dish we liked was Panang curry wich was ok and not perfect. We ordered Pad thai and Thai bbq chicken which was not at all good to taste. Thai coffee was good. Thai fish cake was another disaster better not to order again. I am not sure if i will go again to this place but if i go, i will try green curry or thai fried rice and will then update my review.

I usually get the Pad Thai and spring rolls. The soups are fantastic and quite authentic but are huge portions. Not the prettiest setting but definitely some of the more authentic Thai food in the Phoenix area.

The little cute place got pretty ok food. I don't like how they served us. The waiter literally put the plate on the end of the table, instead of being in front of us. Also, I don't like their Pad Thai
The worst! Food and service are pathetic. Watery curry which finally came 20 minutes after the rest of my table, so I took it to go. Probably wouldn't feed it to my dogs.

A very good Thai restaurant for a large selection of tasty dishes. Easily the best Thai food we've had anywhere on the West side of Phoenix. I'm glad this place is nearby and this was my 4th time over the last 6 weeks. They have the best Thai Iced Tea in AZ.

Considering the West side of town doesn't have a whole lot of Thai places to chooose from, this place is pretty awesome.  Comparatively speaking to all the Thai places I've been to, I would have given it 3.25 stars.  We got their pad na, pumpkin curry, and pineapple fried rice.  I would say the taste is comprable to to other decent Thai places I've been to in the past.  I'll definitely be looking forward to going again in the future!  A friend took us there and they even mentioned that there's karaoke night.  It would be awesome to check that out one evening!

This place is beyond delicious. Their mock tails are actually exactly like those boba bubble tea drinks and I can not get enough! There curries are good, egg rolls, everything I've tried was amazingly authentic. The only thing is I wish they delivered. Then it would be the perfect restaurant.

I just had my second experience with this place- both were on to go orders. First time I got the Tom Kra Gai and was pleased with it. Today I got the wonton soup and Panang beef curry. Both were good but the wonton soup was sooo good! The broth was excellent and it was not lacking in veggies or in the number of wontons they put in there! I was very pleasantly surprised. I walked in 10 minutes prior to them re-opening for dinner and was still greeted with kindness and was able to place my order right away. The young man at the counter (the owner's nephew) was so friendly and helpful in answering my handful of questions. I received above average service for sure. My food was out in a matter of 10 minutes max. Would definitely return.

This is decent Thai food... I really went with the intent to get a Thai Tea.  Mission Accomplished on that front.  But the food is good, not the best or the worst.  They do serve large portions for the price.  There were only a few tables occupied when I had lunch there, and they all seemed please.

This place is excellent on every level! Service, environment, cleanliness and most importantly....FOOD! The portions are fair to the pricing and everything has been cooked perfectly!  Last time was yellow curry with shrimp...Delicious! This time was onions and mushrooms in oyster sauce with duck...amazing!! Hubby had the asparagus with beef...he killed it! We also tried the potstickers with pork...handmade, delicate and flavorful with sauce that put them over the top!  If you like Thai food, you must come here!!!  I don't have a single negative thing to say about it!!!

Sala Thai is a solid choice for Thai food in the west valley where we don't have all that many options. I have only ever ordered take out so I can't comment on the service, but the food is basically always good. We usually get the beef satay (good, a bit dry, but awesome peanut sauce), yellow curry medium heat (which is still fairly mild, but a family favorite) and pad Thai. The pad Thai is good, though I will agree with some of the other reviewers that occasionally the noodles are overdone. For those that find it too sweet I suggest requesting a heat level, as they are typically able to accommodate. The one thing we have ordered that basically got tossed in the trash was the pineapple fried rice. It sounded so good but had a strange, kind of spoiled flavor to it. Also I would not recommend dining in if you are sensitive to smells. It seems they have a problem with their sewage and it tends to smell a bit septic in their dining room. But they have an A food grade, so we don't let it scare us from ordering takeout! If you're way out in the west valley, Sala Thai is a solid (If not your only) choice for Thai food!

The food was awesome..the service, not so much. I love Pad Thai & the pad Thai here was the best I have ever had!! There is only one server here & she doesn't even check on the customers. I had to repeatedly raise my hand to get her attention & she never came so I got up to go and get the take out containers that I needed, I'll return for the food, but I would have to put up with the bad service.

I have struggled to find good Thai food in the valley and this place is for real! The flavor and spice is all there! I am always drawn to the pumpkin curry! Chunks of pumpkin so different and tasty. The staff is very friendly. Prices are reasonable! Great option for good Thai food in Phoenix!

Picked up dinner consisting of masuman curry, drunken noodles and pad thai.    The food was not the same as our other visits.  Rather than the very good experience the food was mediocre at best.  The masuman curry was not even close to previous efforts.  Frankly I could recognize it was curry but not strictly masuman curry.  The Paid Thai was also off from their usual effort.  As if the Pad Thai sauce was the one I get in a bottle from the Asian market.  Could have been an  off night.

I would not normally Yelp but in this case I feel that I would be doing the owner a disservice. We arrived at 11am when the restaurant is suppose to open. The security gates were still on the windows and the server did not acknowledge that we were standing outside. We waited patiently until 11:06 when she opened the door and I asked her if the restaurant was open and she mentioned that she goes to school and can't get here by 11. We walked in and she said we could sit anywhere she then proceeded to put the gates away and set up all the tables and chairs outside and inside before she greeted us finally at 11:16. It would have been nice if she would have said one moment I'm just trying to get the restaurant open I apologize for the wait. The food was great!
Best thai food on the west side. The curries are awesome. Friendly service too.

Not being used to this type of cuisine, I couldn't tell ya if it's authentic or not.  But I did find the Thai Iced tea to be pretty good.  spring roll were rather tasty.  deep fried vegetables were interesting.  the chicken satay was rather good especially if you like peanuts.  I wasn't that into pad thai noodles, but I will definitely be back to try a curry.
Food was hot, salty, and tasted ok, but I am assuming they use massive amounts of msg as it made both of us sick. Service was mediocre.

REally really good.  I had the Ginger Tofu dish ad it was amazing.  The place has the look and feel of a specialty restaurant run by a signature chef.  It's really a hidden secret, nestled in the back of a nondescript strip mall.  Don't let the surroundings fool you, this place is well well worth it.
Best Thai in the Valley! I usually order the Tom kra gai! All the curries are fragrant thick and lovely. Also the spring rolls are perfection!

We ordered 2 of my favorite dishes, panang curry with beef and the tom kra gai (coconut milk soup with chicken). They were both very good, I would go back again. We ordered medium and it was not as spicy as I like it so next time I might go with hot. The rice bowl was very small and we had to ask for for, but no big deal.  The restaurant itself is nice and clean and can't wait to try other menu items!

Although the food was delicious the service here was absolutely terrible. Waited about 10 min to get water. Another 20 min to place our order ( mind you they were nowhere near busy) . Staff only came by once to check and see how we're doing. Again the food was great but that doesn't make up for horrible service and count me out on coming back to this place.

*This is a review for PAD THAI ONLY!*  I love Pad Thai, I searched for about 30 min on yelp to find a good Pad Thai place.  I had 3 in mind and they were all pretty close by including this one, but since I wanted to go, I chose this place since it was closest to the highway.  Honestly, the Pad Thai was little disappointing. I'm sure their other foods are great, but probably not the Pad Thai. I'm no expert or a Pad Thai snob, but out of all the ones I had, this might be my worst (or second worst) Pad Thai I've ever had.   The noodles were overcooked, and I was expecting more green onions, but they were only few short ones lying around. They charged 3 extra dollars for 5 fairly good size of shrimps, which wasn't too bad.  They did put a reasonable amount of bean sprouts and slides of carrots, so that was good.  Also, they put a good amount of peanuts (I think it was peanuts), but I chopped up some roasted salted almonds at home and added them for extra taste, which made it little better.  The sauce wasn't too bad, but it would've been better if it was little spicy and saucier (not salty). It was little too bland for me. It almost feels like eating a top ramen at a ramen place, and thinking that I could've just made it at home.  This would be more like a sad Pad Thai that I would probably reuse the leftover to add more stuff or even make spring rolls out of it.  I'm sure the service is good and all, and I have not tried other food since I normally just go for the Pad Thai. And please remember this is a review just for the Pad Thai.  It looked like a family owned place, and I wish and hope the best for them. If you're owner or worker who works there reading this, please .. save the Pad Thai #RIP #PadThai Thank you.
i am very sad to see this place closed . If any one knows where the owners went that would be great . The Tom Yum was the best I  have eaten in Phoenix.

I had been going here for awhile and the food is tasty. I'm not sure recently if there was a change in management, and just experienced the most horrible customer service today and will never go back again. This is why: 1) I walked in waiting by the door to be seated. The guy host was in range to see people coming in, but stood there obliviously. Then he walked off into the back, and then came back out walking to another booth to chat. Then walked back to the counter, never came up to the door to acknowledge us.  2) I was irritated and walked 10 ft across to the back counter, and he then disappeared to the back kitchen area again. I stood there waiting, and he came out. Never greeted me, and gave me a look of confusion. I asked him if I can finally get a seat for two. He just points across, "Well, you can take that one there or the one over there." (Ok, thanks for seating me!) So we went over and seated ourselves and he finally came to the table to bring us menus.  3) After skimming through our menus, we closed it and put it to the side of the table ready to order. The same guy standing at the bar counter walked past us and back to chat with that same table he had been occupied with after taking the check from the booth behind us. 10 mins past, finally a woman came to take our order.  4) Nobody ever came to check on us, and that guy was still occupied with that same table, or chatting and "cleaning" the empty booth by that table. A family came in, seated themselves at an empty booth closest to the entrance and sat waiting for menus. We were done eating and waited another 15 mins to get a check. As we waited, I see the guy back standing at the bar area.The family who sat themselves sent their kid to the bar counter and he told the guy "We are waiting over there" He then walks back to that table he had bee chatting with then disappeared to the back kitchen. The woman got upset and stood up telling her mom, "let's go, I don't know where that guy went and they are taking to long."  5) The guy comes out and walked up to finally asked if we would like our check.  Their service use to be good when I was last there 2 months ago and before that. Not anymore! .
The best thai on the west side of town! Each and every dish is amazing (i love the noodle dishes). Be sure to check out their lunch specials!

Absolutely love this place! If you go for lunch, make sure to get one of the lunch specials! $7.99 gets you a heaping portion of one of the select main dishes, salad with peanut sauce dressing, an egg roll with sweet chili dipping sauce and a soup. The only thing I will warn about is the spice level--all 3 of us asked for medium spice level on our dishes but they were vey spicy, I recommend dropping down a level just in case. You cannot beat it here! It's very cute and well decorated as well.

I went to this restaurant for lunch. The service was good with friendly staff but slow. The food - my kids had Pad See Ew which was a small portion, too much other stuff like veges or meat but not enough noodles. My curry was good but every bite of the pork had gristle or chewy fat and it turned me off for eating more. Captain rolls were great. Overall, it is a decent place to eat Thai food but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Unassuming little restaurant from the outside, but lovely and traditional inside. Wonderful food, great service, nice atmosphere. Had the fish cakes,  cream puffs and the beef mussuman.  All were perfect.  Quick tip if you're from southeast Asia or Australia: ask for at least 4 out of 5 on the spicy scale.  Highly recommend.

This is the best thai food I have found in the valley.  We had drunken noodles, yellow curry, and the tom kra gai soup. Everything was excellent. Thai iced tea was also delicious. All the ingredients tasted fresh and everything was cooked perfectly.

The food here was nicely presented and yummy. Came in and got seated right away. Service wasnt bad they refilled my water and checked on me a couple times. The panang curry was nice just wish i ordered it more spicy. I love spicy foods. The thai tea was good. Pad thai is delish i always ask for extra sauce cause i like my noodles drenched in sauce. Cant wait to go back

Another 3.5-er.  I'll make this quick since football's on:  ~ Basil fried rice - great ~ Spring rolls - average ~ Papaya salad - great ~ Red curry chicken - good ~ Chicken tom yum soup - good  ~ Drunken noodles with beef - great ~ Mocktails: we had one of each - mango, banana and pineapple banana.  The mango was the best.  There's no alcohol at this establishment, btw.  What good is a restaurant w/o alcohol?!

Best Thai In North Phoenix Our family ate at Sala Thai this evening for the first time. We have been to a number of Thai restaurants in the Valley......this is one of the best. Food is flavorful, spice it as you like, and the service was superb. Spring rolls were great, followed a wonderful soup (Tom Kra  Gai), and Thai BBQ......everything was perfect. Finished off with Fried Bananas served with homemade Coconut ice cream. You won't be disappointed.

One of my favorite places to get tasty Thai Food in NE PHX. Normally come here on the weekends and bring the family and kids. Food is always good and the service is quick and friendly. Best of New Times.  Inside is both fun and inviting with some really comfortable booths. One is right next to a very cool looking fish tank with a lot of eye catching activity. Those crazy little critters are really flying and bouncing all over the place. The wife has to remind me that they are plastic fish and not to get too excited. Ha!  Nice selection of all your Thai restaurant favorites and more. They even have pictures on the menu of several dishes. This is always good when you are wanting to try something new and feel shy.  Like to order my dishes Thai SPICY Hot. The family members just laugh and prefer it more in the Medium range. You can always ask them to bring out more chilies if you want to start off with Mild and work your way up.  Some of our favorites are the Tom Yum (Hot and Sour), Tom Kra Gai (Chicken Coconut Milk) Soups. The Appetizers are all really good as well as any of the Noodle dishes, the different colored Curries, the Spicy Garlic versions, and the many BBQ items.  Bring the crew and ask for Thai Spicy if you dare. It is hotter than the 1-5 scale. Located in a small strip mall and easy to drive right past. SIMPLY YUMTACULAR!

The food was nothing out of the ordinary, but the efficiency and organization of the restaurant that night was absurd.  I was sitting in front of the kitchen and the food counter so I saw and heard pretty much everything.  I ordered a Thai iced tea, fried tofu, drunken noodles, and pineapple fried rice.  The waitress didn't write down my order, so I had to ask for my drink three times and waited for my food for about 25 minutes. I'm fine about waiting for my order, but not when my food is sitting and cooling on the counter for over 10 minutes.  I watched the waiters bicker about who would bus tables, prepare/refill beverages, take orders, and serve the dishes. There was no structure whatsoever. I hope they get it together...
The tom kra gai was tasty as was the pad thai. Service good too. My first time here & I will be back!!!

Wow!  VERY VERY good! A very good friend recommend meeting here for lunch during a recent visit to Phoenix, and I'm SO happy that she did.  Sala is the best Thai I've ever had.  Sala is located in a very run-of-the-mill strip mall, and is a place you could easily overlook.  Definitely look for it and indulge.  My friend ordered a thai curry, and I ordered a hot seafood dish.  Both were amazingly fresh, flavorful, and generously-sized.  I cannot wait for my next Phoenix trip so we can enjoy lunch here again.

Our favorite place to go for consistently great Thai food, best on the Westside.  Family owned and operated by very friendly, good people.   Strongly disagree with Jay P's poor review.   Try it for yourself and you will see.   By the way, the Catfish Soup is awesome!

New owner, new cook, new name (Thai Vegan) horrible changes..  Had the pad thai with shrimp and chicken...  terrible..  the shrimp had no flavor..  the noodles were overcooked..  The BBQ spare ribs tasted boiled..  no flavor...    I wil not go back...
This is one of our favorite Thai places and as we walked in tonight we were happy to see they have expanded!

I'm traveling cross-country with my parents from NYC and we were all really craving some yummy, authentic Thai food (Pam's Kitchen + Pongsri in NYC are both amazing and right up our alley).  Ended up going to Sala because of all the reviews. Have to say - we all loved it!  We got their basil fried rice based on the reviews - and it was awesome.  We also ordered the drunken noodles, the spicy basil leaves with soft tofu and another with chicken (minced).  Everything was delicious!  In fact, between the 3 of us, we finished almost everything.  Kind of ridiculous.  Also, 4 out of 5 (spicy level) was perfect.  We love spicy food and it was the perfect amount of heat.  I would equate it to medium spicy in NYC Thai restaurants, which is really quite spicy but perfect if you can handle heat.  Oh, and not sure about peoples' tastes but we don't love sugar in our Thai food - so if you're the same, be sure to let them know not to add extra sugar.  We forgot to do that and although some dishes were a tad sweet(er), we didn't particularly mind because of the heat.  Still, next time, I would say no sugar.  Also, we ordered the coconut ice cream for dessert and it was great.  Subtle coconut flavor (not too essence-y) topped with toasted coconut.  Alsooo, the servers were really nice.  We arrived at like 8:45pm and despite closing at 9pm (kitchen closes), our server was super sweet.  Would definitely go back to Sala Thai if we're ever in the area again!!!!
This is me and my wife's favorite place. We come every week. The food is amazing and the staff is the best. Highly recommend.

We love this place. Relaxing environment and the freshest veggies ever. The rice is beyond expectation and you can bring your own bottle of wine or beer. We actually dine here at least once a week. The curry is the best in the area.

The restaurant is lavishly decorated with Thai culture motif. We ordered the Tom Yum soup spice level very hot and it was a kick - a**. My son even tried it and enjoyed slurping the soup and quickly reaching out for water to drink. We would definitely go back here and eat.
I gave Sala Thai four stars the first time I reviewed it. I don't know what I was thinking.
great food. Red curry is delirious. However the Pat Thai is too wet for us. We are not a big fan.

I came here with family to celebrate Father's Day. I started with an order of spring rolls. The veggies were very fresh and there was quite a bit of mint. There are three to an order and they are rather large. They came sliced in two and were perfect for sharing. The sweet peanut sauce that came with the rolls was a perfect accompaniment. Next was the mussamun curry..a large bowl of various veggies (you can add meat too) in a very flavorful coconut milk and chili paste broth....awesome!! My only complaint was I ordered it as a 5 heat level-the highest-but the dish had no heat to it. A bit disappointing. The best part was dessert-the fried bananas with coconut ice cream drizzled with honey. I thought I was getting an order for one person and was quite surprised when the waitress arrived with a long plate of three large banana pieces wrapped in a fancy deep fried phyllo pastry purse. Alongside each one came a decent scoop of coconut Ice cream with honey drizzled over the top of the bananas and ice cream. Best dessert ever and it looked as good as it tasted!! Of course I shared this with two others. A honeydew smoothie to wash it down was perfect on a 110 degree day. There were no complaints from anyone in our party and I will be returning soon.
Not a return place-- I was disappointed in the preparation of the the food I ordered and received.
Annoying that their phone rang for twenty minutes and the restaurant seemed to be understaffed, but tasty milk tea and musaman curry/phad Thai! Will go again.

I've given this restaurant 3 stars because I have now tried both locations, and BOY is there a big difference.  I've eaten at the Phoenix location twice; once for take-out and once to dine in.  Their food is quite good.  I found the quality of the curry and soups to be consistent.  The dishes were well prepared and very tasty.  The service in Phoenix was ok.  It can be a bit difficult to communicate, but not impossible.  Phoenix earns a 4.  Goodyear is an entirely different experience.  I stopped there for lunch recently and was very surprised at the difference.  The young man serving tables was rather clueless.  He did not take orders correctly, missed items ordered, took dishes to the wrong tables, and loudly complained about the kitchen staff to customers.  It was AWFUL!  I wish I could send an email to management, but all they have on their website is phone numbers, and if I called I could end up talking to the person that gave us such a bad experience.  The food was not up to par, and Sala should be embarassed at the 'service'.  This location should get 1 star, but I will give them the benefit of the doubt that this was an isolated incident as I have only been to that location once.  Highly doubt I would try it again.

Do you like savory foods? Seriously this place offers some really tasty dishes. So far the yellow curry chicken and spicy egg bomb are the favorites. I prefer to pick up order as the restaurant is a little run down. But everyone is very nice and will happily offer suggestions.
This thai food is BOMB!!! Real great authentic food! Everything is great! Very addicting. You'll love every item in menu and you'll keep coming back!
